summary: This is a confidential memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, dated August 12, 2019. It relays information from the Special Housing Unit regarding inmate movements, specifically noting that inmate Jeffrey Epstein would need a cellmate upon returning from an attorney visit on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Warde
persons.context: Appears to be the intended recipient of this internal correctional center memorandum.

persons.name: Reyes
persons.context: Inmate #85993-054 who was reportedly 'going WAD' (likely an acronym for a transfer or status) and might not return.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054, Jeffrey Epstein, who was to be assigned a cellmate upon returning from an attorney visit.

connections.description: Both are inmates mentioned in the same correctional center memorandum regarding housing assignments.

events.title: Epstein's Attorney Visit and Housing Instruction
events.description: On August 9, 2019, at approximately 1:50 p.m., information was passed that inmate Jeffrey Epstein would need a cellmate upon his return from an attorney visit.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is a confidential memorandum from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated August 12, 2019.
It records internal communication regarding inmate housing, specifically concerning Jeffrey Epstein (Inmate #76318-054).
On August 9, 2019, staff were informed that Epstein would need a cellmate upon returning from an attorney visit.
The document also mentions another inmate, Reyes (#85993-054), who was 'going WAD' and might not return.
This memo was created days before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019, providing context about his status and housing just prior to that event.
